acf.team_size: 5 Team member: 2 Frontend developer, 2 Wordpress developer, 1 QA
acf.initial_goal_content: Agora Real, a New York-based company managing $200 billion in investments with over 100K investors, needed a website that represented their SaaS application effectively. Their previous WIX-based website lacked editing flexibility, performed poorly, and failed to reflect their dynamic and corporate ethos. Agora sought a robust, high-performance, and modern web solution to match their industry stature and accommodate their growing user base.
acf.pain_area_content:
• Daily Website Updates:Agoraâ€™s internal team needed to make frequent changes, requiring a highly dynamic and flexible CMS.
  • Performance Issues:The website had to handle thousands of concurrent users while maintaining speed and responsiveness.
  • Rendering Challenges:Building an SEO-friendly React.js-based website was a significant challenge due to its lack of server-side rendering features.
acf.development_approach_content:
• Frontend with React and SASS CSS: Built the SPA frontend using React for speed and interactivity, paired with SASS for modular and maintainable styling.
  • Backend with Headless WordPress: Developed a custom headless CMS with ACF, providing flexibility for the client to add new pages and content without technical assistance.
  • Server-Side Rendering with Next.js: Introduced Next.js to the React project for SSR, enabling SEO optimization and faster initial page loads.
  • KV Storage on Netlify: Replaced traditional MySQL with KV storage for improved data retrieval speed and deployed the site on Netlify for optimal performance.
  • Collaborative Workflow: Managed the project using Git and a structured agile methodology, ensuring smooth coordination among frontend and backend teams.

deliverables_outlined_list.content: High-Tech Single Page Application: Designed and built a dynamic single-page application (SPA) using React and Next.js to provide a seamless, fast, and visually appealing user experience. The SPA was optimized for high-speed performance while accommodating thousands of concurrent users.

Headless WordPress Backend: Created a custom headless backend with Advanced Custom Fields (ACF), providing flexibility for the client to manage and create content modules efficiently. This approach simplified the process of adding future updates.

Responsive Design Across Devices: Delivered a fully responsive design, tested rigorously across multiple devices and resolutions, ensuring a consistent experience for all users. Special attention was given to interactive features to ensure smooth operation on mobile and desktops.

Optimized Speed and Scalability: Migrated to KV storage on Netlify for faster performance and scalability, reducing page load times to under 0.7 seconds. Extensive load testing confirmed the site could handle over 2,000 users per second, surpassing expectations.

acf.challenges_faced_content:
• SEO Compatibility: Reactâ€™s lack of SSR capabilities initially made the site less SEO-friendly, impacting search engine visibility.
  • Page Load Speed: Despite initial optimizations, the site was taking 3â€“5 seconds to load, far below the clientâ€™s expectations.
  • Concurrent User Handling: The site needed to support more than 50 users per second, a high benchmark requiring extensive optimization and testing.
acf.solution_content:
• Next.js Integration: Implemented Next.js for server-side rendering, resolving the SEO and initial load speed issues. This significantly improved page load times and search engine rankings.
  • KV Storage: Migrated from MySQL to KV storage, reducing data retrieval times and accelerating load speeds to under 0.7 seconds.
  • Load Testing and Optimization: Conducted rigorous load testing, confirming the siteâ€™s ability to handle 2,000 users per second, far exceeding the original requirement.
  • Future-Ready CMS: Built modular CMS components with predefined typography and flexible layouts, allowing the client to create new pages independently.
acf.testimonial_content: Iâ€™ve been working with Mayur and the C&C team for around 6 years now and its always a pleasure they are professional, dedicated and awesome people. I love you guys and definitely we are going to work closely together in the future.

acf.success_story_content:
• The new Agora Real website launched successfully, surpassing client expectations in performance, scalability, and functionality. The integration of Next.js and KV storage resulted in a highly optimized site capable of handling thousands of users concurrently with sub-second load times. The improved SEO and engaging interactive features positioned Agora as a leader in their industry, reflecting their innovative approach and corporate strength.
  • The project marked the beginning of a long-term partnership, with Agora relying on us for continuous updates and enhancements. This project demonstrated our ability to deliver cutting-edge technology solutions tailored to the unique needs of high-stakes industries, solidifying our role as a trusted development partner for enterprise clients.

acf.team_size: Backend developer (2), Frontend developer (2),  GSAP animator (1),  QA Project manager (1)
acf.initial_goal_content: Insoundz, a company specializing in AI for sound and communication, required an elegant website to showcase their groundbreaking technology. The website needed to uniquely highlight the power of their AI tools.
acf.pain_area_content:
• No References: Without prior examples, the design required expertise and creativity to conceptualize from scratch.
  • Frequent Changes: Multiple decision-makers caused delays and revisions during the development phase
acf.development_approach_content:
• Wireframing: Created and refined wireframes to align with the clientâ€™s vision.
  • Custom Design: Designed a visually appealing website, earning approval from the clientâ€™s C-Level officers.
  • Frontend and Backend Development: Developed a pixel-perfect frontend and implemented module-based development using ACF.

deliverables_outlined_list.content: Custom Wireframing and Design: Created detailed wireframes and interactive prototypes to present the concept to C-level executives. Developed a sleek, professional design that showcased Insoundzâ€™s cutting-edge AI sound technology, emphasizing clarity and innovation. The design process included multiple iterations to align with the clientâ€™s feedback and vision.

Responsive Frontend Development: Built a pixel-perfect and fully responsive frontend to ensure seamless functionality on desktops, tablets, and smartphones. Interactive elements were optimized for performance across devices, providing a flawless user experience.

Modular Backend Development: Implemented a module-based backend using Advanced Custom Fields (ACF) in WordPress, enabling the client to update and manage content with ease. The backend allowed scalability for future needs.

Interactive Banner and Media Modules: Developed dynamic banner animations and quick-access media modules to effectively showcase Insoundzâ€™s technology. These features highlighted the brandâ€™s innovation and elevated user engagement.

acf.challenges_faced_content:
• Frequent Revisions: Managed shifting timelines by allocating additional resources to ensure timely delivery.
  • Transition to Single Landing Page: After initial development, the client chose to focus on a single landing page
acf.solution_content:
• Wireframing and Design: Created detailed wireframes and a design that effectively showcased the power of their AI tools.

  • Pixel-Perfect Frontend: Developed a responsive, pixel-perfect frontend to ensure seamless user experiences.

  • Module-Based Development: Built a flexible backend using ACF to enable the client to manage and update content easily.

  • Focus on Interactive Features: Integrated dynamic elements like the banner area and quick media module to captivate users.

We partnered with Core and Core Tech to design and build our new website. I canâ€™t say enough good things about the team and the way they delivered the project. The decision to contract them for the maintenance was a no brainer based on this experience.

Communication â€“ transparent and fluent communication throughout our partnership.

acf.team_size: 7 Team member, 2 UI designer, 2 Frontend developer, 1 QA, 1 Backend developer, 1 Certified Project manager
acf.initial_goal_content: Cruise, a leading company in the UK river cruising market, sought to establish an innovative and luxurious website to represent their unique services. With no prior references in this niche, the project was an exciting challenge requiring a creative and adaptive approach.
acf.pain_area_content:
• Lack of References: The client provided only creative notes, requiring the team to conceptualize from scratch.
    • Balancing Creativity and Performance: Combining luxury, creativity, and adaptive UI with high-speed performance was a significant challenge.
acf.development_approach_content:
Wireframing:
  • Translated the clientâ€™s raw notes into a structured wireframe.
  • Collaborated with the client to refine and finalize the vision.

Custom Design:
  • Designed unique and interactive pages with luxury aesthetics by Adobe-certified designers.
  • Created an elegant branding experience across the website.
Custom Development:
  • Developed the entire website using custom PHP and ACF, avoiding ready-made themes for optimal performance.
QA and Optimization:
  • Ensured fast load speeds and seamless responsiveness across devices.

deliverables_outlined_list.content: Custom Wireframing and Design: Created detailed wireframes and interactive prototypes to present the concept to C-level executives. Developed a sleek, professional design that showcased Insoundzâ€™s cutting-edge AI sound technology, emphasizing clarity and innovation. The design process included multiple iterations to align with the clientâ€™s feedback and vision.

Responsive Frontend Development: Built a pixel-perfect and fully responsive frontend to ensure seamless functionality on desktops, tablets, and smartphones. Interactive elements were optimized for performance across devices, providing a flawless user experience.

Modular Backend Development: Implemented a module-based backend using Advanced Custom Fields (ACF) in WordPress, enabling the client to update and manage content with ease. The backend allowed scalability for future needs.

Interactive Banner and Media Modules: Developed dynamic banner animations and quick-access media modules to effectively showcase Insoundzâ€™s technology. These features highlighted the brandâ€™s innovation and elevated user engagement.

acf.challenges_faced_content:
• Lack of industry references required developing unique ideas from scratch.
  • Balancing creativity, luxury, and adaptive functionality in a cohesive design.
  • Ensuring high-speed performance despite a visually rich design
acf.solution_content:
• Custom Wireframing and Design: Conceptualized and crafted an original design from the clientâ€™s raw notes, ensuring alignment with their vision.
  • Custom Development: Developed the entire website using custom PHP and ACF for a lightweight and high-performance backend.

  • Creative Features: Incorporated visually engaging and interactive elements, such as a mega menu, timeline, and itinerary page.
  • Optimized Performance: Ensured fast load times and seamless responsiveness across devices.

acf.team_size: 6 Members (Backend developer-2, Frontend developer-1, GSAP animator-1, QA-1, Project manager-1)
acf.initial_goal_content: Quilt Software, a $5 billion company specializing in providing POS solutions to local vendors, sought a professional and dynamic website to reflect their business stature. The primary goal was to create a scalable platform with flexible content modules, enabling dynamic page creation, while ensuring top-notch performance and a polished, business-class design.
acf.pain_area_content:
• Dynamic Content Requirement: The client wanted a CMS with flexible content modules that allowed them to generate dynamic pages effortlessly.
  • Scalability and Performance: Ensuring the website was fast, responsive, and scored highly on performance metrics like Google PageSpeed and GTmetrix.
  • Collaborative Development: While the client contributed to the design, we were tasked with crafting the frontend and building a custom WordPress backend.
acf.development_approach_content:
• Collaborative Design Process: Worked closely with the clientâ€™s design team to align the front-end with their vision while infusing technical feasibility.
  • Custom CMS Modules: Built flexible content modules using Advanced Custom Fields (ACF) in WordPress, giving the client the ability to create, update, and manage dynamic pages with ease.
  • Performance Engineering: Focused on lightweight coding, script optimization, and caching techniques to achieve top-tier website performance metrics.
  • Rapid Development Timeline: Delivered the project within a month, ensuring the website was ready for a timely launch.

deliverables_outlined_list.content: Customizable CMS: Developed a flexible content module system that empowered the client to create dynamic pages using predefined modules. This modular backend enabled quick updates without compromising design consistency.

Responsive Design for Business-Class Appeal: Delivered a modern, business-class website with a focus on clean layouts and usability. The design resonated with the brandâ€™s premium image and was tested extensively across devices for responsiveness.

High-Speed Optimization: Achieved top scores on Google PageSpeed Insights and GTmetrix by optimizing performance, ensuring fast load times and smooth navigation. This helped enhance user experience and SEO rankings.
Advanced Security Features: Integrated robust security measures to protect sensitive data and maintain reliability for high-traffic usage.

acf.challenges_faced_content:
• Dynamic Module Complexity: The challenge lies in ensuring each module can be seamlessly combined in any order, all while preserving design consistency and performance.
  • Rapid Development Timeline: Completing a project of this scale within one month demanded extraordinary efficiency. Coordinating between design integration, custom module development, and extensive testing under a tight timeline added pressure to deliver without compromising quality.
acf.solution_content:
• Dynamic Module Engineering: we developed a modular framework leveraging Advanced Custom Fields (ACF) with highly customizable configurations. Each module was designed with conditional logic, enabling dynamic adjustments based on user inputs while maintaining consistent design integrity.
  • Efficient Project Management: Leveraged agile methodologies to ensure timely delivery while maintaining quality standards.
  • Hybrid Performance Optimization: We implemented a multi-layered approach to reconcile performance and flexibility
acf.testimonial_content: Mayur and his team were wonderful to work with. They delivered a beautiful website after rounds of iteration on a short timeline, and were on hand to ensure go-live ran smoothly. The team performed above expectations and I look forwarding to working with them again.
acf.success_story_content:
• High Performance: Launched with top scores on Google PageSpeed and GTmetrix, ensuring fast, reliable performance.
  • Client Satisfaction: The client expressed great satisfaction with the final product, praising the business-class design and seamless functionality.
  • Ongoing Collaboration: This successful launch has strengthened our relationship with Quilt Software, opening doors for potential future projects.

acf.team_size: 5 Members (Backend developer-2, Frontend developer-1, QA-1, Project manager-1)
acf.initial_goal_content: Mad Childcare sought a website solution that was both functional and engaging. The primary goal was to create a platform that allowed easy content management through reusable custom modules while also reflecting a playful and child-friendly aesthetic. The client wanted the design to resonate with their young audience and parents alike, using vibrant colors and interactive elements.
acf.pain_area_content:
• Content Management: The existing system lacked flexibility, making it difficult to update and manage content efficiently.
  • Child-Friendly Design: The previous design did not effectively convey a fun, child-centric atmosphere, which is critical for a childcare business.
  • Engagement: The website needed interactive features to appeal to both children and parents, creating a sense of trust and fun.
acf.development_approach_content:
Understanding the Brand:
  • Collaborated with the client to understand their branding and the emotional connection they wanted to establish with their audience.
  • Studied user expectations for childcare websites to ensure the design and features met their needs.
Designing for Children:
  • Crafted a color palette and visual style that exuded playfulness while maintaining professionalism.
  • Incorporated child-friendly icons, illustrations, and animations to enhance the siteâ€™s appeal.
Custom Modules for Content Management:
  • Developed modular sections with Advanced Custom Fields (ACF), allowing the client to manage and update content easily without technical expertise.
  • Designed reusable blocks to ensure consistency and flexibility across the website.
Interactive Features:
  • Integrated subtle animations and interactive sections to guide users intuitively and keep them engaged.
  • Added a gallery showcasing activities and events to provide parents with insights into the childcare environment.

deliverables_outlined_list.content: For Mad Childcare, we created a website that was both functional and engaging, aligning with the clientâ€™s goal of delivering a platform that resonated with their target audienceâ€”parents and childcare providers. The design incorporated bright, child-friendly colors and interactive elements, reflecting the essence of their services and making the site more appealing to users.

The backend was built with a modular content management system (CMS) using Advanced Custom Fields (ACF), allowing the client to manage reusable content modules easily. This approach ensured that site updates, such as adding new information or services, could be done efficiently without requiring technical expertise.

We ensured the website was mobile-optimized and responsive, providing a seamless experience across all devices. The user interface was designed to guide visitors intuitively through the site, enhancing navigation and ensuring that critical information was always accessible.

Additionally, we created custom functionality that allowed the client to update content dynamically, offering flexibility for showcasing new services or announcements. Performance optimizations ensured that the website loaded quickly, retaining users and encouraging them to engage further.
The result was a professional yet playful platform that effectively communicated Mad Childcareâ€™s services while meeting the technical and aesthetic standards of a modern website.

acf.challenges_faced_content:
• Balancing Playfulness with Functionality: Ensuring the design was fun and vibrant while remaining intuitive and professional for parents.
  • Modular Flexibility: Creating a backend that allowed non-technical users to manage content without compromising the websiteâ€™s structure and design.
  • Responsive Design: Ensuring the playful design elements are adapted seamlessly across devices.
acf.solution_content:
• Custom Content Modules: A flexible backend using ACF allowed the client to create and manage pages effortlessly.
  • Child-Friendly Design: A vibrant and engaging layout with colors, illustrations, and typography that captured the essence of childcare.
  • Interactive Features: Animated icons, engaging galleries, and playful transitions made the site lively and fun.
  • Parent-Centric Features: Easy navigation, responsive design, and quick access to essential information ensured a seamless user experience for parents.
acf.testimonial_content:
The project with Code and core went superbly. Very happy with their work and have already engaged them again for another development project. 
Highly recommend!

acf.success_story_content:
• Streamlined Content Management: The modular backend empowered the client to update content independently, saving time and effort.
  • Increased Engagement: Visitors have praised the fun, vibrant design that immediately captures the essence of childcare.
  • Positive Feedback: Parents appreciated the interactive elements and the transparency provided by the activity galleries and event highlights.
  • Brand Alignment: The new design reinforced Mad Childcareâ€™s commitment to providing a joyful and nurturing environment for children.

our_blogs.post_content:
Most of the time, when we provide WP Support to our customers, we have to answer the question, "How do you know if your WordPress site has been hacked?" I've prepared something like this so you can understand what's going on behind the scenes. Together with some signs. These can be dangerous or cause annoying delays in loading websites.

Here are some of the most common signs that your WordPress site is hacked

  • A sudden drop in web traffic
If you check your Google Analytics reports, you may notice a decrease in website traffic. This definitely indicates that the website has been hacked. Some viruses can hide their effects, while others can redirect her web browser to spam websites. And sometimes you have to pay attention. Otherwise, you'll end up on his list of 20,000 websites that Google filters out.Â Â 
  • Your website redirects you to another site.
This is probably the most recognizable symptom. When you visit a website, you are redirected to an unknown location instead of being served. First, check if your DNS records have changed and point to a different IP address. If your DNS records look fine, it's very likely that something in your HTML page is causing this redirect. Try disabling JavaScript support in your browser and check again if the site is redirecting. If the redirect continues, it likely indicates that another area of â€‹â€‹the website has been tampered with, either the database, the website's .htaccess file, or the web server configuration.Â 
  • A popup will open while the website is loading.
This sign is also easy to understand. Your his website loads a popup window that is clearly out of place. Some of them are called popunders and are more cunning. These are not visible when you visit the website, but are loaded in the background. However, when I minimize the browser, it appears quickly and usually takes up most of the screen.
  • Inappropriate links added to the site
Data injection is one of the most common signs that WordPress has been hacked. Hackers create backdoors on your WordPress site to access and access your WordPress files and databases. Some of these hacks even add links to spam websites. These links are typically placed in the footer of your website, but they can be placed anywhere. Deleting a link does not guarantee that the link will not appear again.
  • A Defaced Homepage
If your website is hacked, your original landing page may disappear. Hackers post their own messages informing them that the site is useless. This is true in most cases, but some people use their intellect to escape without warning. At worst, ransomware can spread and try to extort money in exchange for stolen information.
  • The website is slow/unresponsive
When a web page loads at a snail's pace, you know someone is trying to break into your site. Hackers use anonymous IP addresses to access her website. It also sends more requests to the server than necessary. In such scenarios, checking the server logs and blocking unknown IPs may resolve the issue. But even if this tip doesn't work for you, you should still follow steps to improve your website's performance.
  • Unable to Login into WordPress
If you can't log into your WordPress site, hackers may have removed your admin account from WordPress. Since the account doesnâ€™t exist, you would not be able to reset your password from the login page. There are other ways to add an admin account. However, your site will remain unsafe until you figure out how the hackers got into your website.

Protect your WordPress website from future attacks

Once the website is cleaned, it will be very difficult for hackers to access his website, so you can protect your website. To protect your WordPress website, you need to add a layer of protection around your site. For example, using strong passwords with two-factor authentication can help protect your WordPress admin area from unauthorized logins. We hope this article helped you learn the signs to look for in a hacked WordPress site.
our_blogs.post_title: Is your website SAFE? How to check whether a WordPress website has been hacked?

our_blogs.post_content: Today it's the 14th of June USA flag day. In 1916 President Woodrow Wilson proclaimed June 14 as the official date for Flag Day, and in 1949 the U.S. Congress permanently established this date as National Flag Day. The national flag is very important since it portrays the country to the rest of the world came as the company's logo which can be described as the face of a company. It is the first thing that a potential customer will notice about the company's business and its overall work. Same as a flag, the logo is a company's first introduction to the market. A well-designed logo can pique the interest of the public and invite them to learn about the firm and its services, it serves as the foundation for the entire narrative on which the brand is built along with its architecture. Because a well-designed logo is a visual, aesthetically pleasing element, it triggers a positive recall about your brand that the name of your company alone might not. A well-designed brand logo can finalize everything from the company's background to its mission through the right icon placement and use of proper fonts. Furthermore, a logo is the first thing that your audience will look for when they see any communications from your brand. It should be on all your marketing materials such as business cards, flyers, advertisements, etc. So if you don't have a logo then you are missing an opportunity to make your business stick in the minds of your audience. When you're ready to take the next step and create a logo for your business, our logo makers can help you design a pixel-perfect logo that aligns perfectly with your brand. Click Here to get your professional logo from a highly qualified UI Designer now!

our_blogs.post_content:
What is Page Speed?

Page speed is the time it takes between the browserâ€™s request for a page until the browser completes processing and rendering the content. Many factors affect the speed of a given page including quantity and type of content, the distance the data travels, connection type, device, operating system, and browser.

Why is Page Load Speed important?

WordPress newcomers frequently believe that if their website loads quickly for them, it must be fast. However, due to caching, browser location, and a variety of other factors, your site frequently loads faster for you than for other users. A quick WordPress website is critical in today's fast-paced digital world. Users are generally impatient and will abandon websites that take too long to load. This means that if your website is slow, you may lose many visitors.

Why should you speed up WordPress?

  • Search engines rank websites with fast-loading times higher than slow-loading ones. So, if you want to improve your position in the SERPs, improving the performance of your WordPress site should be one of your priorities.
  • Online buyers are the most impatient, expecting the page to load in less than a second. So, if you run an e-commerce store on WordPress, you should prepare to make significant changes to make your business more profitable.

Here are tips for speeding up WordPress sites:

1. Use Quick WordPress Hosting

Choosing performance-optimized WordPress hosting is one of the most important things you can do to improve the backend performance of your site.

2. Optimize your images

Oversized images are the most common cause of slow WordPress sites. The larger the picture files on your website, the longer your site takes to load. Optimizing your images is therefore a vital step to improving your website speed. Optimizing involves resizing and compressing image files so that they can be retrieved and loaded more quickly.

3. Enable caching

By enabling caching on your website, your site data can be stored locally in temporary storage spaces, called caches. This means that browsers can load your site files more easily and donâ€™t have to re-download everything from your server every time your site is needed.

4. Use a Content Delivery Network (CDN)

People who visit your website come from all over the world, and it goes without saying that the site-loading speed will vary depending on where the visitors are located. There are numerous CDNs that aid in reducing site loading times for visitors from various countries. A CDN stores a copy of your website in various data centers located throughout the world. A CDN's primary function is to serve a webpage to a visitor from the closest possible location.

5. Cleanup WordPress database

Database optimization, meaning deleting unwanted data from your database, will keep its size to a minimum and also helps in reducing the size of your backups. It is also necessary to delete spam comments, fake users, old drafts of your content, and maybe even unwanted plugins as well as themes. All of this will reduce the size of your databases and web files, and thus speed up WordPress

6. Update Plugins

Plugins may be reducing your site speed in various ways. Poorly-designed plugins, plugins with outdated software, or duplicate plugins can all contribute to slow website loading.

Need help?

Weâ€™re an expert WordPress agency with 7+ Years of experience providing WordPress support and maintenance. Please get in touch if youâ€™d like any further help in improving your page speed or optimizing your WordPress website. Click here to contact usÂ
our_blogs.post_title: Techniques To Increase WordPress Websiteâ€™s PageSpeed

our_blogs.post_content:
Hereâ€™s an amazing statistic about mobile. There are almost 5 billion mobile internet users worldwide, and the numbers are increasing yearly. They account for more than 50 percent of all internet traffic. So what does this means for your business? You should first remember that the majority of your customers don't use desktop computers. Any company today with a digital presence must account for mobile users in its web design strategy or run the risk of alienating a sizeable portion of the consumer base. Code and Core provide the best design solutions for individuals (Designers, Developers, Doctors, Advocates, Builders), Corporate Sectors (Medical, Finance, Real Estate, Dentists, Insurance, Law Firms, Call Centers, IT sector, NGOs, MNCs), as well as for business/selling the purpose of the design. Yes, there are many ways to sell web designs you can check on this link to see How to sell Web Design Services?

Why Make My Website Fit on All Devices?

With more internet traffic coming from mobile users, Google has shifted its focus toward mobile-friendly website optimization. Your other organic search efforts could be ruined if your website is not mobile-friendly. To improve or keep your SERP ranking, you must optimize your website for mobile devices. Optimized content, load time, and mobile-friendly web design all contribute significantly to your ranking improvement. However, a mobile-friendly website that is optimized for all devices can work well with your overall digital marketing plan.

Feature of a Mobile-Friendly Website

A website can be optimized in a variety of ways to make it more mobile-friendly. Here are a few characteristics that are frequently present on websites that have been optimized with a mobile-first mindset.
  • Sites load more quickly.
  • There are fewer moving parts and more precise information on websites.
  • Pop-ups are used sparingly and only as needed.
  • Menus are made simpler
  • Contact information is prominently displayed.
  • The buttons are big and simple to use.
  • Information about the call to action is obvious

5 Key Benefits of a Mobile-Friendly Website

There are many advantages to having a website that is responsive to mobile devices. The use of desktop computers is declining, and smartphones are now the preferred form of connectivity. Businesses can take advantage of this smartphone usage by developing a website that is mobile-first and keeping up with the growth of mobile traffic. Simply put, you need a mobile-friendly website because that's where web design is going in the future.
  1. The next generation of customers will prefer using mobile devices to access your business over traditional desktops or laptops because the majority of web traffic today comes from mobile devices. They'll probably learn about your company for the first time via a mobile device. Making a strong mobile responsive website is therefore essential for making a good first impression.
  2. Mobile phone users typically use their phones to conduct online shopping and look for discounts, coupons, quick reviews, or product research. Mobile phone users are the biggest consumers of your goods and services. By optimizing their website with a mobile-first strategy, businesses can benefit from this.
  3. Google usually gives websites that are mobile responsive a higher ranking and listing. Having a mobile-friendly website may make it simpler for Google to rank your website.
  4. Sharing information with mobile devices is one of the best things about them. Share any contentâ€”pictures, videos, or articlesâ€”with your loved ones. Social media sharing buttons are available on mobile-friendly websites.
  5. In addition to their extreme convenience, mobile devices are also preferred for browsing because mobile web pages have less advertising. Display ads are typically minimized for users visiting a website that has been optimized for mobile.

How to Make the Existing Website Mobile-Friendly?

There are some basic steps you can take to complete that yourself. How do I make my website responsive? Here are some strategies you can use, per Google, to enhance the site's responsiveness and mobile user experience.
  • Begin with a mobile-first strategy
This practice of designing and developing for mobile first, then desktop, has the potential to be game-changing. While some developers design and develop for desktop first and then scale down to mobile, this approach can be counterproductive if your primary focus is on mobile-friendly website design. Reversing the process with mobile-first indexing can help you optimize the mobile design from the start.
  • Make use of a Responsive Web Design
A responsive web design is a quick and easy way to create a mobile-friendly website or repurpose an existing one. Installing a responsive theme will automatically make your website mobile-friendly. A responsible website layout also improves your website's SEO value, and Google prefers to rank and index mobile-friendly websites.
  • Take Notice of the Site's Appearance
While content is the primary reason people visit a website, design has a significant impact on your site's bounce rate. As a result, it's critical to make a good first impression. To determine how mobile-friendly your website design is, use Google's mobile-friendly test tool.
  • Turn on Accelerated Mobile Pages
The Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) framework focuses on shortening the load time of your mobile site by limiting HTML/CSS/Javascript and compressing data eight times. As a result, the loading process is four times faster.
  • Improve Button Positioning
You should make mobile-friendly website design easy to find. They should be large enough to be tapped with fingers and strategically placed. Because the majority of mobile users use one hand, the CTA button should be placed conveniently for one-handed use.
  • Make your website's loading time faster
Lowering bounce rates and improving user experience can be achieved by increasing site speed. To get an accurate estimate of your website's loading time, test its core web vitals.

Here are some ideas for improving the loading site:

A. Image Compression Page weight, also known as the "gravity of the web," reduces app performance by increasing load time and lowering network data usage. Image compression apps can be used to reduce image size. B. Put Caching in Place Caching saves website files in a more convenient location, avoiding the need to download a webpage every time it is accessed. C. Making Use of a Content Delivery Network CDN allows you to store web files on multiple servers distributed geographically rather than on a single central server. This contributes to balanced loading times regardless of the user's location while reducing bandwidth consumption. D. Compress your code Optimizing your site's CSS, HTML, and JavaScript code can make it more efficient and reduce loading time by seconds. Are you ready to build a mobile-friendly website or optimize your current one with a mobile-first approach? Code and Core is the right IT partner for you if you're looking for professionals to guide you through the process of developing a mobile-friendly website. Our team of experts is here to help you design a mobile-friendly website and make your company more accessible to your customers.
our_blogs.post_title: Top 6 ways to Create Mobile Friendly Website Design

our_blogs.post_content:
If you are facing any issues from the below list, on your WordPress website then your website might be under attack with some virus or malware code and you need the immediate attention of the developer for your potential website.

1. Unable to delete index.php and .htaccess files. It creates automatically again if I delete this file.

There could be several reasons why you are unable to delete the index.php file like the file is in use, Permission issues, the file is read-only, the file is locked by another process, the file is in a protected folder, A virus or malware is preventing you from deleting the files. Some viruses or malware are designed to prevent the deletion of certain files, so it's possible that a virus may be preventing you from deleting the index.php file. Solution: If your index.php or .htaccess is keep creating automatically even if you have manually tried to delete it multiple times, that means the virus has executed one code file in a hidden format which will keep executing itself on every action, Yes it means whatever you will do in the server it will execute and create that file again. If you like to find what is this hidden file name then you might be going to see it inside the server log file sometimes it looks like this /public_folder/css/style.php or script.php etc, you first need to find and delete this file and if you aren't able to find this hidden file then in either condition you will need to restart your server which will stop the execution of the PHP and then you can easily delete the index.php and .htaccess file. To do this action, you will need the help of a server company if you are having shared hosting account, whereas this can be easily done by yourself if you acquire a VPS hosting plan, here are some of the links where you can see how you can restart the server for some of the trendy servers in the market.
  • Godaddy: https://in.godaddy.com/help/restart-my-gen-3-server-19089
  • Bluehost: https://www.bluehost.com/hosting/help/dedi-vps-restart
  • Bigrock: https://support.bigrock.com/index.php?/Knowledgebase/Article/View/929/13/rebooting-your-vps-or-dedicated-server)
  • Hostgator: https://www.hostgator.com/help/article/how-to-reboot-your-vpsdedicated-server
If you still need help please click here to contact us and we will make sure you will get virus free website.  

2. The website is redirecting to some random/adult/games/shopping website.

If your website is redirecting to another website because it has been infected with malware. Typically this happens when a malicious individual gains access to your website through a vulnerable plugin or theme. In some situations, the issue could be caused by a new file that was added to the root folder. A phishing scam may be attempting to redirect visitors to a fake website in order to steal personal information. Some malicious ads or third-party scripts like analytics or social media widgets can also cause redirects. Make sure to check all the third-party scripts and ads on your website. Solution: Update WordPress to the latest version. Update all of your WordPress plugins to the latest version. Change your WordPress login credentials (username and password) so that anyone who may have gained those credentials can no longer log in. Change your FTP credentials for the same reason â€“ so no one can directly access and edit files in your home directory. Add a plugin to change the WordPress default login URL which is site.com/wp-admin Mostly this code stays inside the JS file so mainly you need to open each JS file, identify the redirecting code, and delete it from that file to stop the redirection. Consider switching to a hosting solution that includes third-party support. All of the hosting plans that we offer here at Sharp Innovations include malware scanning and fixing.

You can also use the below plugins to change WP-admin on your site.

  • WPS Hide Login It is a very light plugin that lets you easily and safely change the URL of the login form page to anything you want. It doesnâ€™t literally rename or change files in core, nor does it add rewrite rules. It simply intercepts page requests and works on any WordPress website.
  • Limit Login Attempts Reloaded Limit Login Attempts Reloaded stops brute force attacks and optimizes your site performance by limiting the number of login attempts that are possible through the normal login as well as XMLRPC, Woocommerce, and custom login pages.
  • Custom Login Customizer This plugin allows you to customize the login page, including the logo, background, and form design.
  • Adminimize This plugin allows you to hide unnecessary items from the admin menu and dashboard, and restrict access to certain areas of the wp-admin for different user roles.
  • White Label CMS This plugin allows you to customize the branding of the wp-admin, including the logo, colors, and text.
  • Admin Menu Editor This plugin allows you to customize the structure of the admin menu, reorder items and create new menus.
  • WP Admin UI Customize This plugin allows you to customize the layout and design of the wp-admin, including the colors, fonts, and icons.
If you still need help please click here to contact us and we will make sure you will get virus free website.    

3. My WordPress website is showing Chinese characters on all pages

Your website may have been hacked and the attacker may have inserted Chinese characters into the website's code. You should run a malware scan and check for any unauthorized changes to the website's code. The problem may be caused by a third-party plugin or extension that you have installed on your website. Uninstall the plugin or extension and check if the issue is resolved. Corrupted files can cause the website to display Chinese characters. Make sure to back up your files and try to replace the corrupted files with fresh copies from a backup. Solution: You should run a malware scan and check for any unauthorized changes to the website's code. Make sure the encoding is set correctly in the website's code or configuration file. Uninstall the plugin or extension and check if the issue is resolved. Make sure to back up your files and try to replace the corrupted files with fresh copies from a backup. If you still need help please click here to contact us and we will make sure you will get virus free website.  

4. Can not see wp-admin anymore?

Your website may have been hacked and the attacker may have blocked access to the wp-admin area. Youâ€™ve made too many login attempts and are locked out of your site, Youâ€™ve changed your login URL and now canâ€™t remember your custom login URL, A plugin and theme may be causing a conflict, A problem with the .htaccess file can cause various issues. Solution: Double-check that you are using the correct username and password. Try renaming or deleting the .htaccess file and see if it resolves the issue. You can check and fix the file permission using an FTP client or using the command line if your hosting provider gives you access. If you are unable to fix the problem by yourself, it's best to consult with a professional or a web developer that can help you to determine the exact cause of the problem and find a solution. If you still need help please click here to contact us and we will make sure you will get virus free website.  

5. Website sees some strange login panel.

Malware can also cause such issues, it may have infiltrated your computer and infected your website files. A phishing scam may be attempting to redirect visitors to a fake login panel in order to steal personal information. There could be several reasons why your website is displaying a strange login panel, including Your website may have been hacked, the attacker may have added a login panel to the site in order to steal user credentials, A hacker may have injected malicious code into your website, third-party scripts on your website, A malware can also cause such issue, it may have infiltrated your computer and infected your website files. Solution: If your website has been hacked or compromised, it's important to take action immediately to protect your site and your visitors. This may include restoring your website from a clean backup, changing all your passwords, and reviewing your website security. It's also important to keep your software, themes, and plugins up to date to avoid known vulnerabilities. If you are unable to fix the problem by yourself, it's best to consult with a professional or a web developer that can help you to determine the exact cause of the problem and find a solution. If you still need help please click here to contact us and we will make sure you will get virus free website.  

6. Seeing some long scripts in JS files.

Your website may have been hacked, and the attacker may have added long scripts to the JavaScript files in order to execute malicious actions. A hacker may have injected malicious code into your website, which is causing the long scripts to appear in the JavaScript files. This can happen through a vulnerability in a plugin or theme or an insecure file upload form. Some third-party scripts like analytics or social media widgets can also add long scripts in your JS files. Make sure to check all the third-party scripts on your website. Malware can also cause such issues, it may have infiltrated your computer and infected your website files. Solution: Make sure to check all the third-party scripts on your website. If you are unable to fix the problem by yourself, it's best to consult with a professional or a web developer that can help you to determine the exact cause of the problem and find a solution. If you still need help please click here to contact us and we will make sure you will get virus free website.  

7. Website is showing some unwanted advertising popups or block

The website may have been hacked, and the attacker may have added unwanted pop-ups or blocks to the website in order to generate revenue through advertising. A hacker may have injected malicious code into your website, which is causing unwanted pop-ups or blocks to appear. This can happen through a vulnerability in a plugin or theme or an insecure file upload form. Some third-party scripts like analytics or social media widgets can also add unwanted pop-ups or blocks. Make sure to check all the third-party scripts on your website. Malware can also cause such issues, it may have infiltrated your computer and infected your website files. If you are using third-party ads on your website, some of them may not be secured and may be injecting unwanted pop-ups or blocks. Some browser extensions could be injecting unwanted pop-ups or blocks, check if you have any unwanted extensions installed in your browser. Solution: Check if you have any unwanted extensions installed in your browser. Make sure to check all the third-party scripts on your website. This can happen through a vulnerability in a plugin or theme or an insecure file upload form. If you still need help please click here to contact us and we will make sure you will get virus free website.  

8. Website is showing red security warning on the browser

A website may display a red security warning on a browser if the website's SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) certificate is not valid or has expired. The SSL certificate is used to establish a secure connection between the website and the user's browser, and without a valid certificate, sensitive information such as login credentials and credit card information may be vulnerable to interception by malicious actors. It can also be caused by some misconfiguration on the server or website. Solution: You should check the SSL certificate of your website and make sure it is valid and up-to-date. If the problem persists, you may need to contact your hosting provider or a website developer for assistance. If you still need help please click here to contact us and we will make sure you will get virus free website.  

9. Unusual behavior in the front end of the website:

A website may be under attack when it experiences unexpected behavior such as redirections, pop-ups, or unexpected changes in the layout.

Solution:

If you suspect your website is under attack, it's important to take action immediately to protect your site and your visitors. This may include blocking the IP addresses that are causing the attack, implementing security measures such as firewalls and intrusion detection systems, and contacting your hosting provider for assistance. If you still need help please click here to contact us and we will make sure you will get virus free website.

There are many plugins available for enhancing the security of a WordPress website. Some popular options include

  • Wordfence Security: This plugin includes a firewall, malware scanning, and blocking features to help protect your site from hacking attempts and other security threats.
  • iThemes Security This plugin offers a variety of security features, including two-factor authentication, password expiration, and malware scanning.
  • All In One WP Security and Firewall This plugin provides a range of security features, including a firewall, user account security, and file integrity monitoring.
  • Sucuri SecurityThis plugin offers a variety of security features, including malware scanning, security notifications, and a firewall
  • Jetpack SecurityThis plugin includes a variety of security features, such as brute force attack protection, two-factor authentication, and DDoS protection.
It's important to note that no plugin can guarantee 100% security, and it is also important to keep your WordPress and plugin versions up-to-date and keep your backup regularly. If you still need help please click here to contact us and we will make sure you will get virus free website.
our_blogs.post_title: What to do if the website is under attacked?

Dedicated Team:

A dedicated team is a form of outsourcing when you collaborate with a vendor to hire and co-manage experts that will work exclusively with you. This model is best for large and long-term projects and achieving certain business goals. While a remote team can work with different clients simultaneously, dedicated experts devote all their time to the tasks you assign. You can manage the scope as you go to reach the best results in the long term.

Dedicated Team fits for:

  • All companies, whether they have software development expertise or not
  • A large project or pool of tasks
  • A project whose scope and timeline might change
  • Rapid scaling and expanding the team
  • Bringing the expertise to boost your company even without clear deliverables

Key benefits of hiring a dedicated Team:

  • Increased Productivity
    The development team or developers work based on their tasks. Once the functions are laid out, they start working on them. The developers then put forth to pass the work for extra corrections. Once itâ€™s done, they can readily move to the next task.
  • Reduced Turnaround Time
    Minimizing time to market is the key to success. Dedicated developers with relevant expertise prove beneficial because they can tap into their domain knowledge to help companies hit the market with the desired product â€“ fast.
  • Increased Cost-efficiency
    With remote dedicated developers, companies can dramatically slash costs and liabilities. Significant expenses like payrolls, pensions, medical coverages, etc., could all be negated. Companies can employ their dedicated teams hourly, mold their services for as many days as required, and end all obligations once the contract ends.
  • Risk Mitigation
    The content developers deliver you risk-free results. Whenever you outsource an experienced content developer, they can get your work done in a possible manner. The risks are lowered in such cases. So you donâ€™t need to be worried about things that arenâ€™t likely to take place. The developers initiate to give a smooth functioning to the companies.
  • Integrations and collaborations:
    The dedicated development team model promises to simulate the tire collaboration among the party, consisting of clients, development companies, and team members. Even with offshore development services, clients can easily manage a dedicated team via internet communication on a daily basis.
Importance of Hiring Dedicated Developers
  • When you are a Fast-Growing Company
  • When you want to finish a project in Law Budget
  • Projects with Dynamic Scope
  • lack of required Talent
Wrap Up:
  • You can hire a dedicated developer for your small to medium project requirements.
  • A dedicated software expert would be a better choice to provide you with quality services and work diligently only on your project for a dedicated project timeframe. They cover very small to complex software requirements. And are idol software partners to work for long term and only when the requirement arises.
  • You can choose the best-suited resource based on your Project requirement and budget.

  • We bring the people who have the best skills and experience in the field or your project and are excited to help you to achieve your vision.
Want to hire a Dedicated Developer? Contact us

Important search keywords

Keywords play the leading role in Search Engine Optimization. One should know which keyword to use to get a particular page. It can be a word or many words. It tells search engines about the content of your website. To find the necessary information people should enter the appropriate keywords. If a personâ€™s keyword matches the keywords of your site, then your site will show up in the result. The result on the search engine is shown as a list which is commonly referred to as ranking, which depends on different factors including quality, performance, relevance, and authority of the site.

How do figure out what keywords to use?

Keywords are the bridge between what people are searching for and the content you are providing to fill that need. The main goal in ranking on search engines is to drive organic traffic to the site from the search engine result pages. Keywords will determine what kind of traffic you get. It works the same as Instagram tags which show users who use these tags. Unique keywords on the website help to reassure users that you have on your site what they are after. once you get all information From your target audience and you know about their requirements you will need to create a list of keywords to target. For example, there is a shop selling ice cream and you want to get an order online so you will write ice-cream shop near me which will show you all the ice-cream shops which are near you. But if you wrote shops near me then it will show all shops which are near you so to find a particular ice-cream shop you will need to write ice-cream shop so it can show you the particular result as you want. So keywords we are using should be meaningful and appropriate to our findings. Even though a keyword may have a lot of search traffic, you always want to ask yourself if that keyword will bring you quality traffic.

How do I include keywords on-site?

Once you have a keyword list then you will either need to include them in existing content or create new content to bring the crowd to your site.Â  There are four places where you can use keywords to start improving your ranking.
  1. Include keywords in page titles
  2. Include keywords in meta descriptions
  3. Include keywords in URLs.
  4. Include keywords in the content.

Track how keywords perform?

After including them on-site it is important to keep track of how those keywords perform. Tools like google analytics will help you see if the targeted pages are receiving more traffic or resulting in more conversations. The ranking works weekly where new content is always being created. Thatâ€™s why tracking keywords perform is important. Keyword maintenance helps you to keep ahead of your competitors and helps to attract a crowd. Are you looking for SEO based website?Â  Click here
our_blogs.post_title: Why search keywords are important and how to implement them in a website?

our_blogs.post_content:
Are you planning to revamp your website or create a new one? Have you considered hiring a Wordpress agency for the job?

Why Is A Website Important for Your Business?

Having a strong online presence, particularly a website, can be a make or break for generating more revenue. One of the main reasons you should have a website for your business is to increase your organization's credibility. In this day and age, some businesses still donâ€™t realize that a majority of their customers will visit their website before making a purchase. Showcasing your brand to your prospective customers is one of the most important things that you can do. Without a website, it can be incredibly challenging to do this because people can't easily find quality and reliable information on your business.

Why WordPress, and What Are Its Benefits?

WordPress is one of the easiest and most robust ways to share your business on the web. There are simpler platforms, but most donâ€™t offer the functionality that WordPress does. And there are a few platforms that are equally robust, but theyâ€™re difficult to use for beginners. WordPress, a content management system (CMS), is the ideal tool for entrepreneurs and companies to showcase their products and services, help their search engine ranking, and market themselves to prospective customers. It helps you share your written content, sell products and services in an electronic storefront, or even just share photos and videos of your work.

Benefits of Using WordPress For Website Development:

  1. Â Â Cost-effective
  2. Â Â Hosting doesnâ€™t have to be a hassle
  3. Â Â WordPress Offers Endless Design Options
  4. Â Â WordPress is Easy to Use and Simple
  5. Â Â WordPress Is Completely Customizable
  6. Â Â Plugins enable you to do just about anything on your website
  7. Â Â WordPress Is Safe and Secure
  8. Â Â Flexible and Scalable
  9. Â Â Responsiveness
  10. Â Â SEO-friendly

Why Should You Hire WordPress Development Agency?

  • Expertise and experience: A good agency will have a team of experienced WordPress developers who can provide you with the expertise you need to get your project off the ground.
  • Cost-effective: Hiring an agency can be more cost-effective than hiring a freelancer or an in-house developer, especially if you need multiple developers for your project.
  • Flexibility: An agency can offer you more flexibility in terms of pricing, timelines, and scope than a freelancer or an in-house developer.
  • Scalability: If your project requires more manpower than what a freelancer or an in-house developer can provide, an agency can easily scale up its resources to meet your needs.
  • Support: A good agency will offer you support even after your project is completed. This means that if you run into any problems down the road, you can always count on them to help you out.
  • Quality assurance: A good agency will have quality assurance processes in place to make sure that your project is delivered on time and up to par.
  • Risk management: When you work with an agency, you can rest assured that they will take care of all the risks involved in your project so that you donâ€™t have to worry about anything.
  • Peace of mind: Hiring an agency gives you the peace of mind that comes with knowing that your project is in good hands.

How To Choose The Right WordPress Agency for Your Business?

  • Decide What You Need Make sure you know what you require before looking for WordPress developers. Do you require a brand-new website, for instance, or only a redesign of an existing one? Do you require continuous support and maintenance? You can focus your search by being aware of your needs.
  • Search for Expertise Experience is something you should look at when picking a WordPress agency. Look through their portfolio to determine if they have experience with projects like yours.
  • Review Their Pricing When hiring a WordPress developer, itâ€™s important to review their pricing. Look for an agency that offers transparent pricing and clearly outlines what is included in their services. Avoid agencies that have hidden fees or surprise charges.
  • Think about timelines If your development work is time-sensitive, itâ€™s important to consider the complete timeline of the agency that you choose.
  • Examine Customer Reviews and Testimonials Examine evaluations and testimonies from past clients before choosing WordPress specialists. This will offer you a sense of their reputation and job quality. Look for agencies that have excellent reviews and happy clientele.
In this manner, you can Hire the best WordPress agency for your needs. Then, if you're still seeking one, you can contact the specialists at Codeandcore for assistance.

Conclusion

Finally, if you want to assure the success of your next web development project, you should consider hiring WordPress developers. Hiring a WordPress firm allows you to make use of their knowledge in producing beautiful, functional websites that are focused on search engines and user experience. You can develop a website that looks amazing, works well, and drives business growth with their assistance. So, if you want to push your online presence to the next level, hire a WordPress agency right away. CodeandCore may be the best alternative for getting a website that meets your requirements.
our_blogs.post_title: Why Should You Hire A Wordpress Agency for Your Web Development Project?

our_blogs.post_content:
What is Lotti Animation?

Lottie is a library for Android, iOS, Web, and Windows that parses adobe after-effect animations exported as JSON with body moving and renders them natively on mobile and on the web! A Lottie is a JSON-based animation file format that can be used on any platform in the same way that static assets can. They are small files that can be scaled up and down without pixelation on any device. The best part is that Lottie animations don't require any coding skills!Â Â 

Why do Lotties play everywhere?

  • Plays Across the Board
The Lottie web player runs on any browser that supports modern Javascript, meaning that Lotties can play on any modern browser. Because most recent software development kits support dynamic web content, this simplifies the integration of Lotties into any desktop/notebook program.
  • Portable and easy to maintain
Lottie animations are saved as plain text and are thus readable by humans. As a result, employing Lotties to create application interfaces cuts down on debugging time and total deployment time. Without the use of specialist software tools, plain text Lottie files are also easy to maintain and fine-tune.
  • Dynamic
Because the data in Lottie is in JSON format, it may be easily modified or altered at various degrees of granularity, from fractional values to big portions of objects. Additionally, the replacement content can be dynamically loaded from any location. As a result, Lottie is currently the most used animated graphics format in the world.
  • Scalable
Modern communication technologies enable enterprises to scale up to volumes that necessitate a variety of data storage and retrieval advances. Because traditional graphical material is hefty, these companies use them sparingly in the development of user interfaces for their apps. Too many graphics may result in unacceptably high storage and retrieval costs, especially when searching and sorting data contextually. The use of Lottie files in large-scale solutions can reduce the costs of storing and contextually sorting/searching graphics content. Using Lotties can also reduce transport costs due to their inherent dynamism - applications need only load the components of a Lottie animation that need updating at any given time.
  • Intuitive Content Workflow
Lottie is currently made by exporting an Adobe After Effects animation into a Lottie file. This implies that existing Adobe After Effects users can utilize the LottieFiles Plugin to create Lottie material right away.Â  Once you are satisfied with your Lottie content, you can start incorporating them into your applications. LottieFiles provides a link to the latest version of the raw Lottie file so that it can be loaded into your applications at runtime.

Wrap Up-

When you employ Lotties in your applications, you'll get quick, dynamic, and stunning user interfaces. Your application's hosted component's storage requirements would be drastically decreased, and your customer's bandwidth use would be drastically cut. In the last seven years, we at code and core have created over 120 websites. Codeandcore Tech LLP is a forward-thinking digital agency with over 7 years of experience in web design and development. Contact Us
our_blogs.post_title: You Will Never Thought That Knowing Lotti Animation Could Be So Beneficial!
